urls.short_description: Main Scrypto language repository with core docs
Officially maintained examples across the stack

folder_tree:
/kb/
├── raw/
│   ├── docs_radixdlt_com.html
│   ├── babylon_scrypto_docs.html
│   ├── scrypto_examples_repo.zip
│   ├── radixdlt_scrypto_repo.zip
│   ├── official_examples_repo.zip
│   └── blueprints_components.html
└── cleaned/
    ├── core_concepts.md
    ├── blueprint_examples.md
    ├── hello_world.rs
    ├── token_creation.rs
    ├── nft_minting.rs
    └── api_reference.md
cleaning_steps: Extract HTML content using BeautifulSoup, removing navigation, headers, footers, and ads
Convert HTML documentation pages to Markdown format using html2text or pandoc
Extract Rust code blocks from documentation and save as individual .rs files with descriptive names
Parse GitHub repository zips to extract README files, example code, and documentation into organized structure
Use regex patterns to clean markdown: remove excessive whitespace, normalize headers, fix link formats
Consolidate related content into thematic files (core_concepts.md, examples.md, api_reference.md)
readme_snippet:
## Data Foundations

This knowledge base contains <RAW_COUNT> raw documentation files and <CLEANED_COUNT> processed files from authoritative RadixDLT and Scrypto sources.

**Sources:**
- Official Radix documentation (docs.radixdlt.com)
- Babylon network Scrypto docs
- Official GitHub repositories (scrypto-examples, radixdlt-scrypto)
- Developer hub and tutorial content
- Community examples and wiki resources

**Last Updated:** <TIMESTAMP>  
**Commit Hash:** <COMMIT_HASH>

The `/kb/raw` directory contains original downloaded content, while `/kb/cleaned` contains processed, machine-readable versions optimized for RAG applications.
